data.title: Free Audio Travel Guide to San Gimignano: Top Sights & Delights
data.meta_description: Explore San Gimignano with Wingman! Experience culture, cuisine, and history like a local. Download Wingman and start your adventure today!
data.text:
Free Travel Guide to San Gimignano

Explore San Gimignano: Your Ultimate Guide to the Jewel of Tuscany

Start My adventure

Picture this: you’re walking through an old town where every stone has a story. San Gimignano, with its tall towers and lovely streets, invites you to step into a place where history comes alive.

Forget just being a tourist, be a traveler!

San Gimignano respects its long history while also enjoying a lively, modern energy. This mix of old and new will capture your imagination and make you curious to learn more.

And guess what? We’re here to help you make the most of your time in this amazing town.

Towers, Traditions, and Tuscan Delights

San Gimignano Trivia - Did You Know?

That San Gimignano has its own secret passages? They might not be as famous as Florence’s Vasari Corridor, but these hidden routes give you a peek into the town’s interesting past. Imagine walking where nobles once did, using these paths to move around quietly.

Top wingman tour in san gimignano

From the enchanting beauty of hidden gardens to the rich history of San Gimignano’s iconic towers, our tours offer the perfect mix of fun and culture.

Put on your walking shoes, get your camera ready, and join us for an unforgettable journey through the wonders of San Gimignano!

Medieval Manhattan – San Gimigano

Welcome to San Gimignano, a charming hilltop town in Tuscany, often called the “medieval Manhattan” because of its impressive skyline filled with ancient tower houses. Back in the 12th and 13th centuries, wealthy families competed to build the tallest and most stunning towers to show off their power and success.

Although there were once about 72 towers, only 14 remain today, still giving the town its unique and enchanting character.

Get to know more, start your tour below!

Exclusive Offer

Get 50 extra credits

Sign up today and grab 50 free credits (that’s up to 100 EUR!) to use on any of our awesome audio tours.

tourist traps and scams

to avoid

in San Gimignano

We know your vacation time is precious, and nothing grinds gears like falling into a tourist trap. So, buckle up as Wingman navigates you away from the “tourist tax” and guides you through a trap-free travel experience with the following slide show…

Overpriced Restaurants

Some local places in prime locations might look appealing but often charge triple prices for mediocre food. Opt for dining spots a bit off the beaten path. Look for places filled with locals – it’s a sure sign of good food at fair prices.

Fake “Authentic” Souvenirs

Shops near major attractions often sell mass-produced items masquerading as local crafts. If you’re after genuine Tuscan souvenirs, head to smaller, family-owned stores. They offer unique, handcrafted items that truly reflect the region’s beauty.

Sketchy Parking Services

Parking can be a pain in San Gimignano. Be cautious of unofficial parking attendants who demand high fees for “safe” parking spots. Always use designated parking lots and ensure you pay the official rates.

"Free" Bracelets and Roses

Beware of friendly vendors offering “free” bracelets or roses; once you accept, they’ll demand payment. It’s a common scam to prey on tourists’ goodwill.

Insider Tip: Politely decline and keep walking. Enjoy the charm of Florence without the unexpected expenses!

Fake Tour Guides

Some unlicensed guides offer their services at popular sites but lack the knowledge and credentials of official guides. Book tours through reputable companies or your hotel to ensure a quality experience.

Top Tip: Official guides often have badges or uniforms – look out for these to ensure you’re getting the real deal!

Excessive Entry Fees

Some attractions may inflate entry fees for tourists. Check official websites or local tourism offices for accurate pricing. Also, consider purchasing a city pass if available – it often covers multiple sites at a better rate.

hidden gems of san gimignano

Discover San Gimignano’s secret treasures! These hidden and unusual spots off the beaten path will make your visit extra special.

Rocca di Montestaffoli

Rocca di Montestaffoli is a quiet fortress offering amazing views of the Tuscan countryside. Climb the ancient walls and feel like you’ve stepped back in time.

It’s a great place for a picnic and some relaxation.

Insider Tip: Visit at sunset for a breathtaking view of the golden hills.

Coordinates: 43.4674° N, 11.0431° E

Santa Fina Chapel

Tucked inside the Collegiate Church, Santa Fina Chapel is a true hidden gem.

The beautiful frescoes by Ghirlandaio are a must-see. It’s a peaceful spot to admire art and history.

Insider Tip: Look for the tomb of Santa Fina, a local saint with an inspiring story.

Coordinates: 43.4672° N, 11.0438° E

Fountain of Piazza della Cisterna

This medieval fountain is often overlooked by tourists. It’s a charming spot in the heart of the town. Perfect for a quick rest and some people-watching.

Insider Tip: Visit early in the morning to enjoy the square without the crowds.

Coordinates: 43.4675° N, 11.0439° E

La Rocca Vineyard

La Rocca Vineyard is a hidden gem just outside the town walls.

Take a leisurely walk through the vineyard and enjoy a wine tasting. It’s a delightful escape from the busy streets.

Insider Tip: Book a tasting tour to learn about local wine-making traditions.

Coordinates: 43.4651° N, 11.0429° E

upgrade travel to joy

Each city is a new chapter in your adventure book, filled with unique cultures, sights, and sounds for you.

culinary delights of san gimignano

From the deliciously tender Bistecca alla Fiorentina to the rich and savory layers of lasagna, San Gimignano is a food lover’s dream. We’ve put together a list of must-visit restaurants where you can enjoy authentic Tuscan dishes full of flavor. Picture biting into a flaky sfogliatella filled with creamy ricotta or enjoying the freshest truffle pasta with a glass of Chianti.

Pappardelle al Cinghiale at Osteria delle Catene

Experience the rustic charm of Tuscan cuisine with Pappardelle al Cinghiale at Osteria delle Catene.

This dish features wide pasta ribbons coated in a rich wild boar sauce, offering a true taste of Tuscany. The cozy atmosphere and friendly service make this restaurant a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

Insider Tip: Pair your dish with a local red wine for an authentic Tuscan experience.

Coordinates: 43.4684° N, 11.0422° E

Tagliata di Manzo at Cum Quibus

Cum Quibus is known for its gourmet touch on traditional dishes, and their Tagliata di Manzo is no exception.

This sliced beef steak, cooked to perfection and topped with aromatic herbs, is a must-try. The elegant setting and creative menu make it a standout dining experience.

Insider Tip: Try their homemade desserts for a sweet finish to your meal.

Coordinates: 43.4671° N, 11.0425° E

Ribollita at Le Vecchie Mura

For a hearty, traditional Tuscan soup, head to Le Vecchie Mura and try their Ribollita.

This vegetable and bread soup is comforting and full of flavor, perfect for a cozy meal. With stunning views of the Tuscan countryside from their terrace, dining here is a delightful experience.

Insider Tip: Visit at sunset for a breathtaking view while you dine.

Coordinates: 43.4679° N, 11.0419° E

Truffle Pasta at Ristorante Perucà

Indulge in the luxurious flavors of Truffle Pasta at Ristorante Perucà. This dish features fresh pasta tossed with fragrant truffles, creating an unforgettable culinary delight.

The warm, inviting ambiance and attentive service make this a top choice for food enthusiasts.

Insider Tip: Reserve a table in advance, as this popular spot fills up quickly.

Coordinates: 43.4673° N, 11.0426° E

cultural insights of san gimignano

From majestic towers that echo tales of medieval power to lively festivals that fill the piazzas with joy and music, San Gimignano is a town where history and modern life blend perfectly.

Join us as we discover the greatest spots and popular events that capture the spirit of this charming Tuscan town.

Galleria Continua

For a taste of contemporary art in a historical setting, visit Galleria Continua. This modern art gallery is housed in a former movie theater and showcases works by international artists.

It’s a unique blend of the old and the new, reflecting the town’s vibrant cultural scene.

Insider Tip: Check their schedule for special exhibitions and events.

Coordinates: 43.4674° N, 11.0423° E

View on the town hall and the church in the old town, San Gimignano Italy

user testimonials

These aren’t just reviews; they’re passports to your next great adventure.

I absolutely loved the tour of San Gimignano! The views from the towers were breathtaking, and our audio guide was so knowledgeable and easy to undesrstand.

Pedro from Spain

The medieval architecture is incredible, and the food was to die for. Climbing the towers and seeing the countryside was the highlight of our trip. A must-do

Johan from Austria

Our tour of San Gimignano was magical. The hidden gems we discovered, like the peaceful gardens and charming cafes, made the experience unforgettable. The audio guide made history TRULY come alive.

Steve from USA

san gimignano top sights

Torre Grossa

Fact: The tallest tower in San Gimignano at 54 meters (177 feet), offering panoramic views of the town and surrounding countryside.

Piazza della Cisterna

Fact: Named after the medieval well in its center, this picturesque square is a hub of activity and features an octagonal stone well dating back to 1287.

Collegiate Church of Santa Maria Assunta

Fact: Known for its stunning frescoes and artworks, including cycles by Ghirlandaio and Benozzo Gozzoli, depicting scenes from the Old Testament.

Rocca di Montestaffoli

Fact: A historic fortress overlooking San Gimignano, offering panoramic views and serving as a strategic defense point during medieval times.

Museo Civico

Fact: Housed in the Palazzo Comunale, this museum features a rich collection of artworks and artifacts from San Gimignano’s medieval and Renaissance periods, including important frescoes and sculptures.
